Description: Ostracon, fragment of the body of a red-brown pottery ribbed vessel, the fabric is partially grey in section, interior covered with a dark-brown resinous deposit, exterior covered with a red-brown slip and remains of two columns of Coptic text written in black ink, six complete lines in the first and the beginnings of five lines in the second, text containing a multiplication table.
Bibliographic references: Crum & Bell 1922 / Wadi Sarga: Coptic and Greek texts (p.53-54)
Hasitzka 1990 / Neue Texte und Dokumentation zum Koptisch-Unterricht (p.260)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (89509) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/89509)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Rain.UnterrichtKopt. 317 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Sarga 23 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
